long: Meaning: to "dock off", i.e. "curtail" (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to "harvest" (grass or grain).  Usage: Ã— at all, cut down, much discouraged, grieve, harvestman, lothe, mourn, reap(-er), (be, wax) short(-en, -er), straiten, trouble, vex.  Source: a primitive root;
